result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:16 AM Cases 22CF21, 22CF49, 22CF146, and 22CM37 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Lisa Lynn Haler.  Def appears from Bayfield County Jail.  Atty Erdman updates the Court- has been appointed now on all matters.  Court reviews status of the cases.  Case 22CF146 is now on for initial appearance. Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Erdman notes the newest case is not currently part of the agreement, will discuss.  Bonds continue.  Atty has until next hearing to file the motion.

Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:52 PM Cases 22CF21, 22CF49, and 22CM37 called together.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video means from Barron County Jail with Attorney.  Cases 22CF21 and 22CF49 on for arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Erdman anticipates she'll file a motion in at least one of these cases, requests STC.  Bond continues.  Defense wishes to discuss bond.  Discussion of allegations.  Atty Erdman argues for bond modification.  Discussion of missed appearance and previously posted bonds.  State argues against the bond modification.  Court amends bond- down to $250 cash (notes previous bond was ordered forfeited).  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on April 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:19 AM Cases 22CF21, 22CF49, and 22CM37 called together.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF49 and 22CF21 are on for preliminary hearing.  In 22CF49, State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Atty Erdman objects- relevance; overruled.  Witness refreshes recollection with report.  Atty Erdman objects- relevance; State responds; overruled.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Erdman crosses.  No redirect.  Witness steps down.  Atty Schmidt asks Court to take judicial notice of bonds; court does so.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State to file information; separate arraignment requested.  Case 22CF21 proceeds to preliminary hearing; State calls first witness, Patrol Sergeant Cliff Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Erdman crosses.  No redirect.  Witness steps down.  State asks court to take judicial notice of bond in 21CF230; court does so.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Letter from def RE: counsel
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:19 PM Called 22CF21, 22CF49 and 22CM37 all for Return on warrant/ INIT.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler in court by video with attorney Michelle M Erdman in person.  Defendant in custody from Burnett Co Jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin in person.  All 3 Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of all 3 complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  In misdemeanors waive further reading and entered NG plea.  Attny Erdman requests Bond modification if the Judge is willing to entertain.  State saw letter and has no objection.  Def confirms contact info is correct.  Court will hear bond argument before setting a PH.  Attny Erdman argues for bond modification, a party to a crime situation and local ties and connections.  Judge notes $2,500 wasn't enough to ensure defs appearance before.  State provides argument, reviews open cases and history of FTP here and Sawyer Co.   Court notes FTP, cash needed to ensure her appearance, Court denies bond modification.  Attny Erdman will Waive time limits for PH by 1 day.  Attny Erdman to let court know if a trial on her calendar requires this to be rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
